results.title: Flowers
results.brief_description:
The third music video / visual from iyla’s 2019 EP, the video ironically uses hypersaturated flowers to comment on the stereotypes of traditional male/female relationships.

Director/DP/Editor: Patrick “Embryo” Tapu

constellations_other.name: Flower on the wind
constellations_other.description: Explore the use of flowers in the moving image as an aesthetic and metaphor.

results.title: Florence: cradle of the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: Leah Joy and Museum Television Workshop
results.brief_description: Narrated by Grace Jackman, with poetry and readings inspired by Florence, and read by Richard Levine, viewers are taken on an artistic travelogue of Florence, focusing primarily on the Renaissance. This commentary provides insight into the architectural and artistic wonders which are an integral part of Florence. From 1436 when Brunelleschi designed the dome of Santa Maria del Fiore, the next hundred years of the Renaissance were filled with seminal figures like Michelangelo, Botticelli, Ghiberti, Cellini, Donatello and Leonardo da Vinci; overlooked by the great patrons Cosimo and Lorenzo de Medici. This video enables the viewer to experience the masterpieces of Florence as an armchair traveller.

results.title: Flood
results.creator_credit: Department of Defence, Canberra and Natural Disasters Organisation (Australia)
results.brief_description: Describes floods and their causes all around Australia. Uses archival footaage (1970s) of flooding in Melbourne (Elizabeth Street), Brisbane and Narrabin. Addresses rural and urban flooding and offers advice to property buyers to check flooding potential before buying. Includes interviews with flood survivors and professionals and describes how weather bureaus can forecast flooding. The message is: Beware! Be prepared!

results.title: Floating free. The Magic rolling board. Log driver's waltz
results.brief_description: Floating free (prod., dir. Jerry Butts): Depicts the skill and virtuosity involved in the 1977 World Frisbee Championships. “The Magic rolling board” (prod., dirs. Jim Freeman, Greg McGillvray): A skateboarding extravaganza which captures every expression of the sport. “Log driver’s waltz”: A short cartoon dedicated to the graceful Canadian log driver.

results.title: Flight to Flinders
results.creator_credit: Peter Young, Ray Barnes and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: A brief tour of Flinders Island, Bass strait, showing its natural features, birds, and points of interest to visitors. Includes a good historical commentary, with some emphasis on the work done by early artists painting flora and fauna.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Young, Ray Barnes and Tasmanian State Film Unit

results.title: Flight of the rhino
results.creator_credit: Gary Steer, Tina Dalton and Sky Visuals
results.brief_description: No other large wild animal is being wiped out at the rate of Africa’s black rhino. If this rate of slaughter continues the black rhino may not survive this decade. This video shows the extraordinary efforts that are being made in an attempt to save this animal from extinction. in a bid to svave them, rhinos are being dehorned, poachers are being shot on sight and rhinos are being transported to safe areas within Zimbabwe and to captive breeding centres overseas. Following the journey of nine black rhinos taken from the wilds of Zimbabwe and flown to Western Plains Zoo in outback Australia. It is hoped that the offspring of this herd will one day be returned to their home in Zimbabwe.

results.title: Flight line one: controlled burning from aircraft
results.creator_credit: D.G. Corke, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Widespread controlled burning of Australian forests - reducing the amount of combustible litter on the ground by burning off at regular intervals - has often been proposed as a fire protection measure. This film shows how aircraft are used in the routine application of this technique in the Jarrah forests of Western Australia.
results.title_for_label: Flight line one: controlled burning from aircraft
results.description: Widespread controlled burning of Australian forests - reducing the amount of combustible litter on the ground by burning off at regular intervals - has often been proposed as a fire protection measure. results.title: Flesh on glass
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, Lucy MacLaren and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Kate’s love for her brother’s wife and the ensuing feelings of guilt lead her to an obsession with the supernatural. We follow her struggle towards self-awareness.

results.title: Flank Breeder
results.brief_description: The myopic Flank Breeder trundles through life filling a small home with small deeds. The world at large is of no consequence…until the accident. A pedestrian duck lays stricken on Flank Breeder’s doorstep. A time has come for action, to quickly lend a hand, but so imprinted is Flank by a small world and its demands, that he finds himself unable to rise to the situation. Script and animation by Bruce Currie.
